Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

decimals().details: By default, RedStone uses 8 decimals for data feeds

returns._0: decimals The number of decimals in the price feed values
dataFeedId The identifier of the data feed
address The address of the price feed adapter

getRoundData(uint80).details: There are possible use cases that some contracts don't need values from old rounds but still rely on `getRoundData` or `latestRounud` functions

returns._0: latestAnswer The latest successfully reported value

latestRound().details: We always return 0, since we do not support rounds in this contract

latestRoundData().details: It uses few helpful functions to abstract logic of getting latest round id and value

returns.answeredInRound: The number of the latest round
returns.roundId: The number of the latest round
returns.startedAt: Block timestamp when the latest successful round started
returns.updatedAt: Block timestamp of the latest successful round

version().details: Currently it has no specific motivation and was added only to be compatible with the Chainlink interface

decimals().notice: Returns the number of decimals for the price feed

getDataFeedId().notice: Returns data feed identifier for the PriceFeed contract

getPriceFeedAdapter().notice: Returns the address of the price feed adapter

latestAnswer().notice: Old Chainlink function for getting the latest successfully reported value

latestRoundData().notice: Returns details of the latest successful update round
